editorialDecl.p: Text input by Maho IUCHI. Marked up by Eva del Rey and Marta Matko in 2006-2007. Imported to 4D on 22/03/07 by Sam van Schaik.

head.p: This catalogue consists of the catalogue compiled by the India Office Librarian FW Thomas on paper slips. The catalogue concerns the Tibetan material from Stein's third expedition, largely manuscripts and printed material from the sites of Karakhoto and Etsingol. This catalogue has never previously been published.

Maho IUCHI input the text of Thomas's catalogue slips into a computer file. Eva del Rey and Marta Matko marked up the text. Marta Matko edited the XML document, assigned the correct shelfmarks and checked inconsistencies against the original manuscripts.

note.p: Fragmentary at lower left corner, somewhat stained and smudged: ll. 8 recto + verso of gooddbu canscript: marginal no.drug, 6.
Fragment of a hymn to Buddha.
Beginsrdzin gi yon tan mang 'byung dang/de las de nyid snon pa'i thabs mkhas dang/
Verso, 5, a new section beginsde na bzhugs pa'i ston pa mtshungs med de/chos kyi sku la snang pa mtha' yas shing/
Slightly fragmentary at lower right corner: ll. 6 recto and 6 verso with a corrector's line in another hand verso, of ordinary squaredbu canscript; marginal no.bzhi, 4.
A fragment, mentioning a number of (Tāntrik) divinities arriving from different regions.
Begins -/kyai bde ba chen po 'i pho brang nas//dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo dang//'khor lo ston pa he ru ka//bcom ldan dgyes pa rdo rje dan(g)//
The work therefore is of theKāla-cakrasect, naming the palaceMahā-sukha, theKāla-cakra, its inspirerHeruka, and aJinaDgyes pa rdo rje=Hevajra.
Many sentences begin in the form-de ring ...
See E.G.013.p (IOL Tib M 6, fol. 6 in the same volume).
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 8 recto and verso of ordinarydbu medscript, rather smudged.

Medical; from theAmṛta-hṛdaya-aṅga-aṣṭa-guhya-upadeśa-tantraor from the supplement ('Lhan thabs')Akāla-mṛtyu-pāśa-khaḍga, of which fragments are contained in E.G.016.l (IOL Tib M 862), 016.r (IOL Tib M 165), 0249.

Begins -...es phar byon //le'u rgyad (rgya) dang lnga 'chu drug la 'sla'ar (??) bya ste gang zhe na 'di lta ste// //gleng gzhi(Nidāna)gleng slong gzhi dang dngos 'khri (e ?)n dang //gso ba'i [tha]bs dang tshos kyi le'u/
The passage refers to a 'chapter 156' and also to a chapter on 'treatment' (gso ba'i thabs) and 'ripening' (tshos), as well as tonidāna(gleng gzhi), etc.

In the India Office xylograph (Lhasa Expedition, D. 1) of theAmṛta-hṛdayathe chapters 1, 2, 5, of vol. I deal withgleng gzhi,gleng slongandgso thabsrespectively. But the like would perhaps be the case with the supplement,Akāla-mṛtyu ...(India Office xylograph, D. 5). In neither of these is there a chapter numbered '156'; but the former consists of Vol. I with 92 chapters, Vol. IV with 27 chapters, giving a total of 156 chapters.
Cf. E.G.023.t (IOL Tib M 712)
Fragmentary at r. and (slightly) at l.: ll. 7 recto + 5 verso of gooddbu canscript.
A tantra fragment, mentioningVajrapāṇi,dharma-satya,mantra,mudrādhiṣṭhāna(phyag rgya'i byin brlabs), andrasa(ro mchog)

Begins -@@//bduSb / dhU paṃ / 'Aloke / gandhe...(puṣpa-dhūpaṃ āloke gandhe ...)dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje dang //...chos rnams kyi bden pa dang / snags dang phyag rgya'i byin rlabs gyis/ ro mchog brgyan dang ldan pa yi/...
Perhaps the text ends verso, where the usual prayer for all creatures occurs.
Complete except for holes: ll. 7 recto 6 verso of rather pointed, not very gooddbu medscript.
Asādhanaaddressed toHeruka, perhaps one of those contained in the Bstan 'gyur (see, Index by Mdlle. Lalou).

Begins -@@//'der p(b?)yon// //hUM bde chen chos sku mkha' khyab snang mtha' yis/ /He ru ka dpal ldan skyes longs spyod ongs/ /pad ston las 'khrungs sprul sku padma 'byung/ /sku gsum rdo rje gsum ldan spyi bor mchod/.
Fragmentary at l. (slightly) and r.: ll. 5 recto and verso of ordinary squaredbu canscript.
A Tāntrik fragment, somewhat similar in substance to E.G.013.b (IOL Tib M 2, Vol. ... fol. 2)

Begins -@@//brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams/ /de ring mdun gyi nam mkhar byon/ /ma rig mun bsel mdzad pa'i/ /rgyal blon ... sems 'pa' dang/ /sgra sgyur lo paN thams cad kyang/ /de ring mdun gyi nam mkhar byon/
The linede ring, etc, recurs as a refrain; cf.013.b.
Folio complete: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather pointed, very fairdbu canscript, somewhat smudged; a few interlinear notes indbu med.
A list of names ofBhikṣus, arranged under alphabeticakṣaras,ki khu, e.g.
recto, 2-/ki/dge slong skal bzang bzod pa/dge slong skal bzang brtson grus/
verso, 4/khi/dge slong bzang po shes rab/dge slong skal bzang mkhas grub/...
Fragmentary at l.: xylograph, ll. 3 recto of ordinary squaredbu canprint; no writing verso, the half of the originally double fol. having been lost.
A story of a horse and an ox, a lion and a sham horse, apparently a parable.
L. 1-/rta dang glang po rnams kyang phugs kyi 'khrul rgyam bslad pa'i m[...u]m tha snyad pa'i shes pa la...
L. 6-'jam dpal dbyangs kyis rje bla ma la snang phyogs la rtsigsu byed
Mentions a certainMañjuśrīghoṣa, whose name is borne by the author of asādhanain the Bstan 'gyur, Rgyud, 43, foll. 171- (I (II), p. 169): also a lama.
A strip: ll. 2 recto of cursivedbu medscript with flourishes and compendious writings; fol. no. 2, l. 10r.
A list of monks.
Begins -dge slong/skal [bz]ang/kod (for kong?)/zer/dge slong/skal [bza]ang/blo/gros/...
Part of lower margin lost; discoloured; ll. 6 per page of ordinary, squaredbu canxylograph, rather faint; in the left-hand margin the titleLam rim 'khridand the folio numberre bzhi'64'.
Fragment of aLam rim 'khrid(perhaps theLam rim,Bodhi-patha (mārga-krama))

Begins -.../bar skying thag pa nas bsam/rang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu ldan du gyur bar mos blo gros sprul te tsha ba'i dmyal bar char chen po phab nas me bsad pa sogs dmigs pa dang so char ma 'debs
Somewhat fragmentary in margin, writing space complete, discoloured: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinary, square,dbu canxylograph: in marginspy[o]d,zhe brgyad, 'Spyod, 48'.
Apparently a prayer in verse (gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa) addressed toTsong kha paunder his personal name,Blo bzang grags pa'i dpal.
Begins -/tshig spyi'i bsad sgrub rtags kyi dge slong gis//thub bstan ming tsam kyang ma bphyung [pa]'i dus// bslab gsum lung rtogs rgyal ba'i dam chos kun//khyod kyis nyin mod mdzad la gsol ba 'debs/

Verso, 5-/thub bstan phyogs dus kun tu rgyas mdzad pa'i//blo bzang grags pa'i dpal gyis bkra shis shog//ces rgyal ba thams cad kyi mkhyen brtse gcig tu bsdus pa'i ngo bo/lnga brgya me rgyu(?) mas kyi gtsug [-]i [-]o bya/dpal ldan bla ma dam pa rje btsun pa cab pa chen pa gnyed kyi rnam par pa mdo tsam zhig brjed pa'i gro nas gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di na//sde grong nas dge sbyor sdom brtson ...
The marginalspyod(= Sanskritcaryā) seems to be only a class designation, not title of the work (cf. 016.t (IOL Tib M 20)): similarly the recurrentchos spyod.
Complete: xylograph, ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather neat, square,dbu canprint: in margin, left, titlechos spyodand folio no. 74, right, recto and verso, Chinese signs CHCH, and the number '74'.

A poem addressed to aDge 'dun dpal ldan 'phrin las bzang po, whose name resembles that of the XIIth Dalai Lama,Blo bzang 'phrin las rgya mtshobyMkhas grub nor bzang rgya mtsho, in verses of 9 syllables.

Begins -/blo chen rnams kyis gzhal bar mi dpyod mod/
/'on kyang bstod tshigs chu yi zegs ma ni/
/.......
/mkhas grub nor bzang rgya mtshos mdzad ba'o/zi__//oM swasti/
/rab dkar dge tshogs sdong gis bskrun pa'i sku/
/'dun ldan rgya mtsho' re ba skong ba'i gsung/
/dpal ldan zhes bya ma lus gsal ba'i thugs/
/'phrin las bzang po rtag tu rgyal gyur cig/
The marginalchos spyod, which recurs in the case of other texts, may be, likespyodin 016.b (IOL Tib M 11), a class designation, not a title.
Slightly fragmentary in margin: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in margin the volume signkha(2) and the folio numberbcu gnyis, '12'.
A poetical prophecy (Buddhist) concerning some country, a fragment.

Begins -/dgon pa'i lam ni dpag tshad mang por zhugs pa'i mis/
/gnas rdzi mtshams kyi nags tshal phun sum tshogs mthong na/
/'di dag grong dang grong khyer nye ba'i rtags snyamste/
/dbugs phyi rnyed par gyur cing chom rkun 'jigs pa med/
Slightly fragmentary in margin: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in margin volume signsa, 28, or folio numberlnga, 5.
A folio of theGośṛṅga vyākaraṇa,Ri glang ru lung bstan pacorresponding to the passage foll. 339.b. l. 2-340.a l. 6 in the Bka' 'gyur, Mdo, vol. 30 (Narthang edition of the India Office).
Slightly fragmentary in margin: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in margin volume signthu, '70' and folio numbergnyis, '2'.
A Tāntrik fragment, consisting for the most part of names of spirits or demons with the recurrent phrase, mutatis mutandis.
bdag 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la yang.....rbod stod gtong ba dang smod zor smo ba dang gnod byed sarba bho bzlog rbad/.

Practically complete: ll. 6 recto (l. no. 2 in small type) + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, smudged and difficult to read: in margin the titleLhan thabsand the fol. numbernyis brgya nga bdun'257'.
A medical work: see under E.G.013.d (IOL Tib M 3), 016.c (IOL Tib M 254), l (IOL Tib M 862) and r (IOL Tib M 165).
The fragment begins -/byid tsan dan dmar//dmigs su byugs te rta prarAs(?) drangs pas 'drongs/(tsan dan =candana)
Fragmentary at r.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather neatdbu canxylograph; in margin rectoca chos spyod.. bu cu gnyisanddkod, 'Vol. (?) V,chos spyod, 12', verso the fol. numberbcu gnyis 'og, '12b'.
A poem addressed toBuddha, a fragment: verse of seven syllables (cf. 016.n (IOL Tib M 18)).

Begins -/rten 'byung mthong ba legs par sngags/
/de yang kun tu med pa dang/
/rang bhzhin gyis ni yod bas min/
/ltos med nam mkha'i me tog bzhin//
The marginalmchod spyodis perhaps not a title: cf.spyod(016.b (IOL Tib M 11)) andchos spyod(016.e (IOL Tib M 12), etc.)
Fragmentary at r.: fol. no. 13 of the same xylograph as E.G.016.m (IOL Tib M 17)
A poem in verses of seven syllables, probably the same text as in 016.m. (IOL Tib M 17)

Begins -mi 'gyur/
/khyod gsung du ma ci zhig smos/
/cha shas de yi don tsam la'ang/
/'ol spyi tsam gyi nges rnyed ba/
/de la'ang mchog gi bde ba ster//

Fragmentary at r. and in margins: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinary, pointeddbu canxylograph; in margin 'spyod' and the folio numberbrgya zhe brgyad gong148a, verso the folio numberbrgya zhe brgyad 'og, 148b.
Fragment of a work concerning retribution in future lives for irreligion, sacrilege etc.

The fragment begins -/dam/ dge 'dun gyi dkor ram/phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi dkor phrogs pa dang 'phrag tu...'robbing the treasure of theSaṃghaor of theSaṃghaof the Ten Regions...' Concerning the marginalspyodsee under 016.b (IOL Tib M 11).
Fragmentary at r. and at bottom ll. 6: recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in marginchos spyodand the fol. numberso drug, 36.
Chos spyod(Dharma-caryā), partly in verses of nine syllables.
In l. 4 recto ends a colophon 'translated byDge 'dun ryga mtsho'i dpal' (the IInd Dalai Lama (1479-1541 A.D.)?
In l. 5 verso is a mention ofTshul khrims rgya mtsho, the Xth Dalai Lama (1817-1837 A.D.)?
The new section, recto l. 4, begins -//mkha' mnyam 'gro la mkhye...mi mdzad zhing gi dpal gyur ba/followed bynamaskāras toSākya-muni,Nāgārjuna, etc.
Concerning the quasi titleChos spyodsee under 016.e (IOL Tib M 12), where the text is somewhat similar; perhaps also in 016.q (IOL Tib M 255).

Complete: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of a rather squaredbu canxylograph, somewhat resembling that of the Paris national fount represented in theRgya cher rol paas edited by Foucaux; in margin left,chos spyodand the fol. numberbrgya bdun, right recto and the fol. number '107' verso and the same fol. number.

Fragment of a work in short statements, on practice of Buddhism. Begins -.../pa'i ye shes dang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsan bar gyur pa'o//de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo//yang dag par rdzogs pa'i snags rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'o/
On the marginal quasi title,chos spyod, see under 016.e (IOL Tib M 12).
Complete: xylograph, similar to E.G.024.f (IOL Tib M 22, Vol. ..., fol. 28); the marginal number is 108 (left Tibetan, right Chinese).
A continuation of the preceding text and print.
Ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, smudged; some insertions in smaller print; in marginchos spyod(fol. number lost).
chos spyod(Dharma-caryā).
In verses of nine syllables. Part of the same text and print as in 016.p (IOL Tib M 21): cf. also 016.e (IOL Tib M 12)., where see note on the quasi titlechos spyod.

The fragment begins -las rab 'das pa'i/
/khyod kyi thugs rje'i 'gran zla 'khyod nyid las/
/bde gshegs mkhyen pas ji tsam dpyad kyang ci/
Fragment at l. at r. and at bottom; ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; fol. number lost.
Fragment of a Tantric work (asādhana?)
L. 2. -/g-yon gnyis nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa/ byang shar du gau rI' ljang ku sbom zhing thur la gsus pa 'phyang ba/
Slightly fragmentary in margins: ll. recto and verso of rather formal, clumsydbu canscript, including formulae in red ink; in margin the fol. number '10'bcu thams pa.
Fragment of a Tantra work with formulas for muttering, etc.
Begins -/bud+d+he bhya #0F14; na ma a rya a wa lo ki te shwa ra ya/bo d+hi sa twA ya/...ces gsungs tshar gcig gis sna drangs snying po brgya dang bdun te brgya rtsa brgyad bzla'o/
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 3 of cursive, epistolary,dbu medscript.
A letter.
Begings -...'i man rtsan gzhi' la...chung 'bul 'phra//zhabs brtan sgrub ched du/.
Fragmentary at r.: ll. 5 recto + 3 verso in a different hand recto + 5 verso of ordinary cursive,dbu medscript, rather smudged; in margin the fol. numbergcig'1'.
Materia Medica
Begins -/ri la rtsdan dang gra bur/dang a ka(?) rtsa dang nim ba logs pa che 'ongs par byed[ pa]'i sman ro
rtsdan: inserted above line, =rtsan dan=candana;gra bur=kar-pūra?;'a ka rtsa=arka?;nim ba=nimba
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph.
The conclusion of some Sūtra, apparentlyThar pa chen po phyogs su rgyas pa(verso, 6), which would be the work described bypp. 56-7, Mdo 23, foll. 285-
Buddha defines the consequences of honouring and not honouring the Sūtra, and the gods,lokapālas,guhyakas,nāgarājas,asuras, etc. etc. request to be allowed at act as its protectors.
Begins -...'am/khyim pa'i khyim du 'am/dgon pa na gnas kyang rung ste/gal te gang zag 'ga' zhig gis sug pa mi gtsang bas mdo sde 'di bzung ngam/ma gus par...
Fragmentary at l. and in margins: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, rather smudged.

Fragment of a poem addressed to a Buddha in verses of fifteen syllables. Begins -la lar gdug an klu yi ded dpon seng ge'i sgra dang gzhan du ni//don yod zhags dang mgrin sngon la sogs rnam pa du ma'i rang la/mentioningSiṃhanāda, leader of poisonNāgas,Amoghpāśa,Nīlakaṇṭha, etc. (allNāgas?).
Slightly fragmentary in margin, little loss of text: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in margin volume signya, '23' and fol. numbergnyis, '2'.
fragment of a Tāntric work, clearly a part of a collection of selected texts: cf. E.G.024.k (IOL Tib M 32).
The fragment begins -bdun pa dang /../drug pa dang /mgo bo lnga pa dang/mgo bo gsum pa dang .../mgo bo stong pa rnams la//bcom ldan 'das kyis mnas bsgag go/- then some formulae.
Nearly complete: xylograph similar to fol. 31; in margin the volume sign similar to fol. 31; in margin the volume signra, '24', and the fol. numberdrug, '6'.
Fragment of the same collection and print as in fol. 31.
The text is part of asūtrawhereBuddharemoves the doubts of a female demon (srin mo):Ānandaalso speaks.
The fragment begins -/mgon par 'grub bo//de bzhin du bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa rnams yod na/'di lta ste sems can dmyal ra' ma dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam/...

Slightly fragmentary in margins: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph + l. 1 at top, giving a title in smaller type; in margin signs and numbers, namely rectotsi, '77'?,gcig byon'1a', versotshu, '108'?,gcig, '1'.
(a)Da na pa ti(SanskritDā(Dha?)-na-pa-ti)

Phyugs nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i gzhungs, 'Dhāraṇī allaying all cattle diseases', in the heading and colophon entitledParNa sha ba ri'i phyugs nad zhi bar byed pa'i gzungsandParNa sha ba ri'i gnag gzungs dang phyugs gzungs.
Parṇaśabarī ... dhāraṇī.
'A dhāraṇī to Parṇaśabarī allaying all cattle diseases': cf.p. 104, Rgyud 14, fol. 259, andII:13,III:47, Rgyud 71, foll. 50, 233.
Begings (a. 1) -/lha mo parNa sha ba ri la phayg 'tshal lo//'di ni phyugs kyi lha yin te//phyugs ma rnams la bsrung bar mdzod/...
(b)A pa ra tsi ta sit ti ghu yA(SanskritAparajita-siddhi- guhya)

p.title: Gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po 'A pa ra tsi ta'i gzungs

note.p: (The heading omits)
Mahā-Yakṣa-senā-pati-Aparājita-dhāraṇī.
Begins (verso, 1), afternamaskāras as asūtra-'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na/...
Aparājitabeing the first speaker.
In the Bstan 'gyur (See, Index by Mdlle. Lalou) are several texts relating toAparājitaandMahā-Yakṣa-senāpati, but apparently nodhāraṇī.
Complete: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; in margin vol. signja'7', titleZa ma togand fol. numberbcu, '10'.

A Tāntrik (not a grammatical) work. The fragment begins -/kyu'i phyag rgya byas la/maMhe #0F14; ta bho ma hA kro d+ha A gats+tsha A gats+tsha masmU da pu dza pra ti gri h+Na nA pra sA da ma d+hI mA na ku ru swA hA/.
Fragmentary at r: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather neatdbu canxylograph; in margin the folio numbersum brgya don drug, '376'.
Shes rab gyi pha rol tu phyin pa(Prajñā-pāramitā)
Dialogue withŚakraand theBodhisattvaSadārudita, corresponding toAṣṭasāhasrikaXXX pp. 496-?

E.G.024.u-z (IOL Tib M 39, 38, 42, 41, 40, 35), aa-ff (IOL Tib M 43, 44, 47, 45, 36, 48). Fragmentary at r.: similar to fol. 36, belonging to the same xylograph; marginal volume signka, and numbersum brgya don brgyad, '378'.
To the same print belong further
(1) E.G.024.v (IOL Tib M 38), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 377.
(2) E.G.024.w (IOL Tib M 42), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 381.
(3) E.G.024.x (IOL Tib M 41), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 380.
(4) E.G.024.y (IOL Tib M 40), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 379.
recto, 6 -/'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa las rtag tu ngu'i le'u zhes sum cu pa'o/'Of the Ārya-aṣṭasāhasrika-prajñā-pāramitā the Sadā-prarudita chapter, the thirtieth'.
(5) E.G.024.z (IOL Tib M 35), fragmentary at r. and elsewhere; fol. no. [3]74.
(6) E.G.024.aa (IOL Tib M 43), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 382.
(7) E.G.024.bb (IOL Tib M 44), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 383.
(8) E.G.024.cc (IOL Tib M 47), fragmentary at l.: in right margin Chinese number.
(9) E.G.024.dd (IOL Tib M 45), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 385.
verso, 1. -...brgyad stong pa las/sgyu ma lta bu'i le'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o//
...chapter twenty-six, entitled 'Like a phantasmagoria', (Māyopama, sc. c. XXVI of theAṣṭa-sāhasrika-Prajñā-pāramitā)
(10) E.G.024.ee (IOL Tib M 42), fragmentary at r.; fol. no. 375.
(11) E.G.024.ff (IOL Tib M 48), fragmentary at l.; in right margin Chinsese number.
Fragmentary at r.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather neat, square,dbu canxylograph; in margin the volume signka, '1' and fol. numbersum brgya gya drug, '386'.

Part of asūtrain which theBodhisattvaSadā-praruditaandŚakraare concerned. The passage relates partly toacintya-vīryaand probably belongs to c. XXX in theAṣṭa-sāhasrika-Prajñā-pāramitā. Begings-/'di ni rdul che ste/sa phyogs 'di na sa rdul gyi khams byung bas byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi lu ...
Complete, stained and somewhat smudged: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of excellent, neatdbu medscript, small size; in left margin volume numberka, l and fol. number= '63'. A ritual, Tāntrik text.

Begins -/man chod gzhi nas len dgos pa yin gsung /dge bshes sdon pa'i zhal nas skyabs 'gro shor na rdom pa gzhan rnaMs mi 'chor spang ro bzhin du nus du 'gro pa yin skyabs 'gro yod chud na sdom pa gzhan rnamMs kyang sor chud pa yin /

Practically complete; similar to K.K.v.b.011.c (IOL Tib M 51), a part of the same MS.: in l. margin volume signka, '1' and fol. number,zhe dgu, 49. Subject Tāntrik, as in K.K.v.b.011.c (IOL Tib M 51).
Begins -/.../'dzin 'jug byas saM [ri]n thang bcad dam spangs te btang na chos kyi skyabs 'gro zul 'bud gsung bas cho'i rten mi spang /
Fragmentary at r. and l., yellow: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neat, cursivedbu medscript, medium size; a few interlinear glosses in a minute hand. Instruction in Yoga, metrical.

Begins -rgyas las stsogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams /
/de rnams sgyu ma'i sman kyis gso' /
/chos gang gis ni byin...
/'dod yon lnga 'i bde ba yis /
/byis pa rnams ni 'ching brjod de /...

Fragmentary at r. and l., yellowish, stained: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of neat, rather thickdbu medscript, large size; a few interlinear glosses in a minute hand; the verse parts inked over in red streaks.
Apparently a commentary upon akārikāḥwork relating to thePrajñā-pāramitā: cf.II:284,III:497, Mdo 14, foll. 333-128, foll. 419-,Prajñā-pāramitā-saṃgraha-kārikā
Begins -...sems dang sbyin pa latshogs pa sgrub pa'i spyod pa legs par bzhag nas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'o ...

note.p: Fragmentary at l. yellowish; the last fol. of a MS.: recto ll. 3 of good, neatdbu medscript of medium size + l. 1 of punctuation marks + l. 1 in a smaller hand; verso in a different hand...'o...gu du(su?) 'god pa la kho bo //
A Sūtra, concluding phrase and part of the colophon, giving the title asChos spyod thams cad kyi man ngag // //mngon par rtogs pa....Chos spyodadded below the line in a smaller hand.
Sarva-dharma-[caryā]-upadeśa. Abhisamaya..cf.I (II):298, Rgyud, 68,Sarva-dharma-caryopadeśa-abhisamaya-tantra-vyākhyā.
The last two lines of the concluding verse give perhaps the locality where the MS. was written and the scribe.

p.q:
//mdan ma dben tsha dpal bya ba yin //
/lag pa 'phrul kyi lde myig lags //

note.p: namely the retreatMdan ma dben tsha dpal(hermitage) and the scribe (lag pa, 'hand')'Phrul kyi lde mig(a strange name for a person).
Fragmentary at l., yellowish, discoloured: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of excellent, neatdbu medscript, of small size; a few interlinear notes in a minute hand.
A commentary upon some text.

Begins -...ng ste don du na bskyed rims pa'i spyod pa'o //tshul corrected to chO ? ba'i spyod pa'o zhes pa ni mu ga ti(mukti) zhes pa'i sgra las grol ba'i spyod zhes mchog 'grub par...pa'o.../gsungs ste / ...

The text proceeds to comment on the phrasesde nyid,legs par mchod nas,bsgom par bya,dngos grub kyi 'bras bu,des,bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid,zas su,dam pa,'bras bu,rigs de dang 'brel pa'i,'jig rten gyi chos brgyad, and so on.

It tells a story of certainYogins of'o sorace who made use ofmahā-māṃsa(human, their own, flesh) and were interrogated by a king. At the end it discusses the meaning of the Sanskrit expressionśa-ta-maṃ-sa, which it translated byzla ba drug, 'six months', and it says that from the wordmāmsais derivedmaṃ-sa-khya, denoting a period of 3asaṃkhyeya.
Fragmentary at r.and l.: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of good, rather flowing,dbu medscript, of medium size; interlinear glosses in a minutu hand od similar type.
A commentary upon a work in verse concerning the service (sten) ofKalyāṇa-mitras, etc.: cf.Pl. CXXXIII and p. 1089andp. 62, Mdo, 27, foll. 379 sqq.,Kalyāṇa-mītra-sevana-sūtra.
Begins -ldan bshes gnyen rab tu sten byed za bring min /zhes bya ba sten ba'i gnas yin te chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa la brten nas/...

Practically complete: ll. 1 recto a smalldbu canscript (title) + a number and a line in cursivedbu cansupra; ll. 4 verso ofdbu can(ll. 1, 3) anddbu med(ll. 2, 4), partly in red, with two lines ofdbu canheading, one suare, the other cursive, size small except in the case pf ll. 1, 3 verso.

Title:'Rab yid nang tshan khro bo zhes pa shing mo glang lo'i le'u tho kun gsal me long, 'Chapter of the Feminine-Wood-Ox year, called Praceto-'ntarlakṣana-khrodhana, entitled 'Mirror illuminating all ...'
Under the name of the year is '18' in red. The lines above give the number 118 and the words 'elapsed year of thernam dag grub', 'Very Pure Attainment' (viśuddha-siddhi?)reckoning.
The number 118 points to the 59th year of the Sixty Years Cycle, which in India is, in fact, the yearKrodhana.

The two lines verso in squaredbu canare Sanskrit-ak+shara dz+nyAna bIro mahA saukhika #0F14; d+harmad+hAto yubAyau byasak+to dibaM/d+harmang/(this word is added in a different hand)[2]Adi nAthAshatArasya kAn+taM nRita #0F14; ramyatAM kAla tsakra naag+dzaMhRidi//

i.e.akṣara-jñāna-vīro mahā-saukhikaḥ dharma-dhāto yuā yau vyasakto divam/ ādināthāśatārasya kāntaṃ nṛtaḥ ramyatāṃ kāla-cakra-naya-jñaṃ hṛdi//and the Tibetan lines indbu medare a translation thereof. Above the Sanskrit syllables are written numbers giving the values of theakṣaras, in groups of three. The heading explains that the metre issama-vṛtta, (sdeb sbyor pa'i bṛtta), and adds a calculation referring toprastara(a technical expression in metrics).

From a-Bdud rtsi snying po yan lag brgyad pa gsang ba man ngag yon tan rgyud kyi lhan thabs zug rngu'i tsha gdung sel ba'i kang pA ra...(Amṛta-hṛdaya-aṅga-aṣṭa-guhyopadeśa-guṇa-tantra-sahopāya-śalya-uṣṇa-tāpana-anta-kṛt-kanpāra(kātpūra? =khaḍga)).

This is a chapter on 'removal of the hot pain of piercing wounds' (zug rngu= Sanskritśalya), belonging to a work named 'Sword cutting the noose of untimely death', (sword =ral gri, Sanskritkhaḍga), (SanskritAkāla-mṛtyu-pāśa-cheda-khaḍga), which work is a supplement (lhan thabs, Sanskritsahopāya,) in India Office copy also calledgaṇḍūṣikā) to the medical textBdud rtsi.....rgyud(SanskritAmṛta-hṛdaya...tantra). Concerning the work and other E.G. fragments of it see under E.G.013.d (IOL Tib M 3).
A left-hand fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of gooddbu canxylograph: border lines: marginal title and number, rectoca chos spyod brgya zhes bdun gong, i.e. 'vol.(?) V,chos spyod, 147a' verso '147b'.
From aChos spyod(Dharma-caryā). Salutations to variousTathāgatas, etc. The text may be akin to that in 016.p (IOL Tib M 21).
A right-hand fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of very baddbu canxylograph, sub-normal size; border lines.

The discourse by theBuddhais delivered on theKhalatikahill (see Monier Williams' Dictionary) and the sūtra is therefore, no doubt, identical with that noted in Beckh's cataloguep. 56 (Mdo. 22, foll. 333 sqq).
(b) 016.l (IOL Tib M 646), marginal number, recto,ka brgya zhe drug gong, Ka, '146a', verso similarly '146b' (also in Chinese).
End of chapter 16 (Lha mo dpal gyi le'u,Śrī-Devī-parivarta) of theGser 'od dam pa md[o sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po](Suvarṇa-prabhāsottama-sūtrendra-rāja), and beginning of c. 17.
The well known sūtra: for the Tibetan version see Beckh's catalogue of the Bka' 'gyur,p. 102 (Mdo 13, foll. 194.sqq., 14 foll. sqq). In the Sanskrit text, as edited by, the chapters are VIII and IX.
(c) 016.j (IOL Tib M 647), fragmentary at l. and r.
(1) Beginning (verso, 1) of-'Phags pa Bar du gcod pa thams cad sel ba'i gzungs,Arya sarba antara saM grA sa dha ra Ni mantra(Ārya-Sarvāntarasaṃgrāsa-dhāraṇī).
For the work see Beckh's catalogue of the Bka' 'gyur,p. 116 (Rgyud, 15, fol. 101).
(3) Beginning (verso, 8) of-'Phags pa Spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzungs,Arya A ba lo ki te shva ra nA ma dhA ra Ni(Ārya-Avalokiteśvara-nāma-dhāraṇī).
A work of this name is given byp. 124 (Bka' 'gyur, Rgyud, 17, fol. 13).
(d) 016.w (IOL Tib M 648), fragmentary at r. and elsewhere; marginal number partly lost, recto 5 (Chinese) andSdud ba gong,Sdud ba a, versothu drug,Thu'6'.
(e) E.G.019.a (IOL Tib M 650), nearly complete: marginal number and title, recto'a gya bzhi Bcings grol gong, 'a, '84a'Bcings grol, verso similarly 'a, 84b' (also Chinese).

End (recto, 4) of -'Phags pa G.yul las rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs(Ārya-samara-vijaya-nāma-dhāraṇī) and beginning (recto, 4) of -Lus ngag yid gsum brtsings (bcings) pa las rab tu rgyal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs,KayA ba kicipra ta stambha na bi dza yA dhA ra Ni(Kayā-vāk-citta-stambhana-vijaya-dhāraṇī).

Refers toĀnanda(l. 3), astag cho ra ma can gyi nags khrod(Vyāghra āraṇya, l. 3), certain flowerska ya tsa dur, (Kaya-catura?) etc., and to creatures who had become tigresses (recto, 2) and are converted ? apparently the conclusion of the story.
Fragmentary on four sides: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of gooddbu canxylograph, large size; border lines.
End of c. 14 of aPrajñā-pāramitā.
Fragmentary at l.and r.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph; border lines.
From a Buddhist sūtra (?)
recto, 3/dper na mnga' yas rgya mtsho'i gting thug tshal ba ltar//shes rab kyis ni brtags na phung po'i...
Another 015.m with 015.l (IOL Tib M 642)?
Folded in concertina shape, so as to give foll. 7, each c. 13 x 7 cm: ll. 7 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, medium size; vertical border lines.
From a ritual work.
Mentions varioussa bdag, 'earth spirits', occupying various abodes in earth, water, etc., etc.
Begins -bdag dang/sribs ri la gnas pa'i chu sman dang/phu'i brag za yag la gnas pa'i ja ri dang/mnga'i chu mig la gnas pa'i lum dang/bye skyabs kyi brtsas ma la gnas pa'i gam sa dang/...

E.G.019.d (IOL Tib M 653), e (IOL Tib M 654), s (IOL Tib M 667), pp (IOL Tib M 684), parts of foll. 4 from one or more copies of a collectaneous work: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, very black ink; border lines; marginal numbers (smaller type), recto number and title at l., the same in Chinese at r., verso number only (in Chinese also).
(a) 019.d (IOL Tib M 653), marginal number and title 'Tha13,'Phags pa Stobs po che', verso 'tha, 13'.

p.title: Rig sngags kyi rgyal po stobs po che'i snying po

note.p: Dialogue betweenBuddha,VajrapāniandSubhūti: cf.p. 129, Rgyud 18, foll. 163-,Mahābala-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra: cf. E.G.019.ii (IOL Tib M 680).
(b) 019.e (IOL Tib M 654), marginal number and title, recto 'Ri, 4,Nor bdag Ku ber', verso 'Ri, 4' (also in Chinese).
End of - (recto, 1)gnod sbyin rnams kyi gzungs(Yakṣa-dhāraṇī, with wpecial reference toKuvera?).

(c) 019.s, fragmentary at r.: marginal number and title, recto, 'Di, 9,Khro bo phyir zlog pa', verso, 'Di, 9' (Chinese number nearly all lost). From aPhyir bzlog pa ngan sngags kyi 'khor lo(verso, 3) (Pratyaṅgirā-mantra-cakra).
(d) 019.pp, fragmentary at r.; Chinese number at r., and title.
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 4 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, rather large.
From a Tāntrik work (Buddhaand aDevī) interlocutors:namaskāras.
verso, 4 -...'phel bar byed pa'i gzungs(...vardhana-dhāraṇī).

E.G.019.h (IOL Tib M 657), i (IOL Tib M 658), j (IOL Tib M 659), k (IOL Tib M 660), l (IOL Tib M 661), m (IOL Tib M 662), foll. 6 from one or more copies of a collectaneous work: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, normal size; border lines; marginal numbers recto, with (other) numbers added on foll. 23-6 in MS.
(a) 019.h (IOL Tib M 657), nearly complete: marginal numbersgsum, '3' and in MS.gsum brgya zhe brgyad, '348'.
From a Buddhist Tāntrik work: mentions various Tāntrik divinities (YamāntakaandVajradharakīlā, verso, 6) andphur bu(Kīla) (recto, 1, etc.), and givesmantras.
(b) 019.i (IOL Tib M 658), marginal numbersre bdun, '67' and in MS.gnyis brgya re drug, '266'.

From a Buddhist sūtra.Buddhaspeaks withĀnandaof an aged woman who in a future birth will be his mother: refers (verso, 3 and 6) to aBuddhaByang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog byed(Bodhyaṅga-kusuma(pus pa)-kara).
(c)019.j (IOL Tib M 659), nearly complete: marginal numbers recto,Tshi bzhi,Tshi, verso,rngi(?) and in MS.bzhi brgya so drug, '436'.
(1) (recto, 5) end of -Gnod sbyi 'A pa rA dzi ta'i gzungs(Yakṣa-Aparājita-dhāraṇī, cf.II (III), pp. 91-2, Rgyud, 72, fol. 303-,Mahā-yakṣāparājita-sādhana-tantra).
(2) (recto, 6) beginning of-Gnod sbyi gter bdag drug gi gzungs(Yakṣa-ṣaṇ-nidhi-pati-dhāraṇī).
(d) 019.k (IOL Tib M 660), nearly complete: marginal numbersgsum rnga bra, '3Rnga bra', and in MS.bzhi brgya re brgyad'468'.
Gser 'od dam pa'i rnga sgra(Suvarṇottama-dundubhi-ṣvara).
Tāntrik formulas and verse, mainly referring to the text itself.
(e) 019.l (IOL Tib M 661), right half.
Mention of various harmful beings,srog 'phrog pa rnamsand a recurrent phrase concerning what they severally devour.
Zas su lhag ma za ba rnams, (recto, 1).
Kaumārī,Vārāhī,Indrī,Agni,Yama,Nairṛti,Kālarātrī, etc. (verso, 1-2).
(f) 019.m (IOL Tib M 662), right half.
From a Buddhist Tāntrik work (Dag pa gser gyi mdo thig, verso, 2?).
Mentions (verso, 1) -rkong rtse lha yi rgyal po('itch, orringworm,deva-rāja?).

A practically complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + verso of good, rather pointeddbu canxylograph; border lines; marginal numbers recto,kha rma chen po nyer gnyis, 'vol.(?)Kha,Rma chen po, 22' (also Chinese), verso Chinese.
From theRig Sngags ki rgyal mo rma bya chen mo(Vidyā-rājñī-Mahā-Māyūrī).
On this work see the article by M. Sylvain LŽvi in Journal Asiatique, (pp. 102-3, Rgyud, 14, foll. 25.a. sqq).
The fol. gives part of the list ofYakṣas.
Text complete: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, rather less than normal size; border lines; marginal title and numberRnam mkhyen ka bcu[ gc]ig, 'Rnam mkhyen,Ka(Vol. 1), 11'.
From a work on theMādhyamikadoctrine: mentionsyogācāryas (recto, 4),ĀcāryaZhi ba chos srol phye ba,Ye shes sde(recto, 5),Zhi ba 'tsho(verso, 6).
(verso, 6,Śāntirakṣita),Seng bzang(Seng ge bzang po,Simhabhadra, see S. C. Das,Dpag bsam 'jon shin, p. CXIX, and, Index by Mdlle. Lalou) and Jaitari (verso, 5).
E.G.019.u (IOL Tib M 669), v (IOL Tib M 670). fol. 35-36, right half of fol. ll. 10 recto + 10 verso of pointeddbu canxylograph, rather large size; border lines.
E.G.019.u (IOL Tib M 669)
(1) End verso, 9 of c. 17 of a Buddhist sūtra (Buddhaand aDevī Srī...).
(2) Beginning (verso, 9) of -Arya Su wa rna sa ta nA ma mahA ya na sU tra(Ārya-Suvarṇa-sata-nāma-Mahā-yāna-sūtra).
E.G.019.v (IOL Tib M 670)
Right half of folio
(1) End (recto, 2) of c. 16 of a- (...dhāraṇī)
(2) Beginning (recto, 3) of -Arya A pa ra rtsi ta ghi rad na si ti nA ma(Ārya-Aparājita...ratna-siddhi-nāma).

E.G.019.x (IOL Tib M 672), aa (IOL Tib M 675), bb (IOL Tib M 676); parts of foll. 3 from one or more copies of a collectaneous work: ll. 10 recto + 10 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, rather large size; border lines; marginal number, (fol. 42), Tibetan and Chinese.
(a) 019.x (IOL Tib M 672), right half.
Apparently a dialogue betweenBuddhaandVajrapāṇi Vajradhara. Sentences of prophecy of the type -thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang byang chub kyi sems kyang rab tu brjed pa med par 'gyur ro/
recto, 10bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes.....shwa ra ma hA bA tsa sarba dharmA ga ga nA ma ....
(b) 019.aa (IOL Tib M 675), fragmentary at l. and r.

(1) Part of colophon of a work (Don shes pa 'od,Artha-jñānāloka?) handed down in a dream in the'Um bu glang mkharor'Om bu gla sgangpalace in the time of theBtsan poLha tho tho ri snyan shal(or ¼gnyan btsan).

p.q: dam pa'i chos 'byung ba'i snga ltas su lha tho...shal [gyi ]sku ring la pho brang 'um bu ...babs mi rabs ldan 'di'i don shes pa 'od zhes rmi lam du lung bstan te chos ...

note.p: For a similar story concerningLha tho tho ri gnyan btsansee theRgyal rabs gsal ba'i me long, ap. Franke, Antiquities of Indian Tibet, II, pp. 80-1.
(2) Beginning (recto, 2) of -'Phags pa Glang ru lung bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo(Ārya-Gośṛṇga-vyākaraṇa).
The well known account of the origin of the Khotan Buddhism (p. 70. Mdo 32, foll. 266 sqq.;58-,I, pp. 1-).
(c) 019.bb (IOL Tib M 676), fragment of left portion: marginal number, rectoBrgyad skyobs (zhe drug gong)(also Chinese), verso similarly '46b'.
From a work apparently entitledBrgyad skyobs, 'The Eight Refuges' composed in the time of the Dalai LamaDge 'dun 'grub pa dpal bzang po(1391-1478 A.D.).
verso, 8,sAkya'i dge slong dge 'dun grub pa dpal bzang pos yun ring [du]...relating to protection from various faults and fears.

E.G.019.y (IOL Tib M 673), mm (IOL Tib M 682), 024.e (IOL Tib M 691), d (IOL Tib M 692); parts of foll. 4 from one or more copies of a collectionous work: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso ofdbu canxylograph, rather pointed, rather large size; border lines; marginal numbers recto and verso in Tibetan and Chinese.
(a) 019.y (IOL Tib M 673), left half; marginal number, rectoka brgya nyi su gong, 'Ka, 120a', verso similarly 'Ka, 120b', also Chinese.
From a ritual text,mantras invoking various Buddhist Tāntrik divinitiesVaiśravanarecurring. One of themantras seems to be named (verso, 3).
[Bcom] ldan 'das kyi spyan sngas yid bzhin gyi nor bu(Buddhasya-antike-Cintāmaṇi).
(b) E.G.019.mm (IOL Tib M 682), right half.
From a work in verse, dealing apparently with the duties and prosperity of kings and people.
(c) 024.e (IOL Tib M 691), nearly complete: marginal numbers, rectoka bzhi gong, 'Ka4a', verso similarly '4b', also Chinese.
From a Buddhist sūtra,BuddhaandĀnandainterlocutours. The scene is apparently theŚālavana, (recto, 3) of which Buddha foretells the future sanctity.
(d) 024.d (IOL Tib M 692), marginal numbers, rectoka brgya chon lnga gong, 'Ka, 175a', verso similarly '175b', also Chinese.

From a Buddhist sūtra: description of a paradise.Buddhaaddresses (verso, 7) aRigs kyi lha mo(Kula-devatā)Yang dag par sdus pa. ABuddhaRab tu ngang pa'i zhal 'Utpala'i dri brtsagsseems to be mentioned (verso, 4).
Fragmentary, discoloured: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, rather large size; border lines.
Description in verse of a Buddhist Tāntrik divinity.
Mention (recto, 7) ofYum chen sangs rgyas spyan gyis tshe...
Fragmentary at l. and r.: ll. 10 recto + verso ofdbu canxylograph, large size; border lines.
Pronouncement of blessings (at end of a sūtra?).
recto, 7-/yan lag bcu drug gsung gis bkra shis shog/
yang lag bcu drug=ṣodasāṇga
Left part: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of rather pointeddbu canxylograph, very black, rather large size; border lines; marginal number and title recto 'Tha,'Phags stobs po che bco lnga15', verso 'Tha, 15'.
Rig sngags kyi rgyal po Stobs po che bgegs dang rnam par log 'dre...(Vidyā-mantra-rāja-Mahābala-vighna-vināyaka: cf. E.G.019.d (IOL Tib M 653)).
Buddhais the speaker (recto, 4).
Left fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of pointed, rather square,dbu canxylograph, large size; border lines; marginal numberNyo bzhi Byams zhus, 'Nyo('128') 4,Byams zhus'.
From a Buddhist sūtra; perhapsByams pas zhus pa(Ārya-Maitreya-paripṛcchā-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra,pp. 24. 38, Dkon brtsegs 6, foll. 91-, Mdo 13, foll. 74-).
Fragmentary at l and r.: l. 1 recto outside title (also Chinese) + ll. 5 verso of good, pointeddbu canxylograph, large sise; border lines.
'Phags pa Zangs mchu dmar po...gdug pa'i phyogs thams cad gnon par byed pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs(Ārya-rakta-tāmroṣṭha...sarva-dig-ākramaṇa-kara-nāma-dhāraṇī??).
Arya Ghadzha pra tang bhan dha ghA tA kang kang prit tsa kha dha yA(Ārya-Gaja(?)-pratibandha-ghAta.....?).
Begins with salutations: a Buddhistdhāraṇī.
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 3 recto of ordinarydbu canxylograph; border lines.
Byang spyod la brten pa'i 'chi blu'i cho ga(Bodhicaryā-āśrita-mṛtyu-vañcana(?)-vidhi) ByŚākya bhikṣuBlo bzang dpal ldan ye shes(the XIIIth Paṇ-chen,Sumatiśrījñāna, 1737-1779 A.D. ?).
Fragmentary at r.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso ofdbu canxylograph, normal size; border lines: discoloured; marginal number.
Fragment of Buddhist religious poetry (Mi la ras pa?).

Begins (recto, 1) -/dur khrod chen po bsil ba'i tshal/
/'jigs su rung ba'i gnas mngon na/
/gshin rje'i ngar skad da ri ri/
/ma mo'i shugs glu kyu ru ru//recto, 7 mentionsHūṃMañjughoṣa.
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canxylogtaph, normal size; border lines; marginal number partly preservedGa(?)bcu 'a(? 2 ?) 'Ga(?), 1-'.
Description of a Buddhist Tāntrik divinity or divinities.
Fragmentary at r.: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of gooddbu medscript, rather small size; quotations overlaid with red ink; marginal number 'sa co brgyad,Sa, (title?), 18'.
From a work on BuddhistYoga.
recto, 2 -rnal 'byor pa rten kyi gang zag gyis bsgrubs na/rdzas kyi ni sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga'o //
verso, 2 -mthar du yang dag sbyar par bya ni huM zhabs sbyar //sngags ni kun tu brjod/bya ste ni [OM a ]hUM ngo /
Fragmentary at l. and r.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of gooddbu medscript, medium size, with citations in a somewhat larger hand; a few annotations in a minute hand.
From a work on BuddhistYoga.

recto, 1 -/de la rang nyid nang du phun gsum tshogs pa ni rang don dang gzhan don gnyis so /
/rang don ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang chos kyi sku gnyis bstan to /
rang don ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku=rūpa-(svabhāva)-kāya,chos kyi sku=dharma-kāya
Complete: ll. 7 recto + 6 verso of gooddbu medscript, small size; interlineation notes in a minute hand, red ink; marginal numbergnyis, '2'.

End of -Rgyud bla ma'i bsdus don(Uttara-tantra-nīta-artha) byLo tsa Dge slong Blo ldan shes rab, perhaps connected with theMahāyānottara-tantra-śāstraandvyākhyātranslated byBlo ldan shes rabin Bstan 'gyur, Mdo 44, foll. 54-, 74- (II (III), p. 374).
Fragmentary at l.: ll. 7 recto of gooddbu medscript, small size, with a few interlinear notes in a minute hand; verso ruled lines, red, only; marginal number,bcu bdun, '17'.
Title -Dpal ldan rgyud rgyal [gsa[l ba'i 'dus pa(Śrīmat-tantra-rāja-prakāsa-samāsa (saṃgraha)?).
The last fol. of the work, giving a colophon.

Colophon, ll. 4-5d[pa]l ldan rgyu[d] rgya[l] ...l ba'i 'dus pa ni //
sgron ma lta bur rgya cher ga... .. .. .. gang thob des //
bdag gi tshig la gus pas 'dug rnams kyis //
gzhung 'di'i bye brag gsal bar rtogs pa dang //
bdag kyang myur du mngon par sangs rgyas nas //
'gro rnams kun gyi mgon por 'gyur bar shog //
Nearly complete: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of gooddbu medscript, minute size.
Buddhist story of a wreckedsārthavāha(ded dpon) and a king, of an ox namedBhutabala(Pyutpala?), of a tigress and abhikṣunamedSrod nya 'A na(Srad nya 'A ya?).
Fragmentary at l. and r. : ll. 10 recto + 9 verso of good, elegantdbu medscript, partly faint through abrasion; smeared with red ink.
Apparently from a catalogue, or abstract of books or of a system.
recto, 1 -de la ['a] ste me lha sgom zhing mchod pa dang /dngos grub blang zhing gshegs su gsol ba dang /[rt]or ma [rt]ang pa'o //
recto, 3 -sgrub pa'i thabs dngos po //de la 3 ste /bskyed pa'i rim pa dang /rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang...
sgrub pa'i thabs dngos po=sādhana-vastu
recto, 6 -mchod bstod bya ba bstan pa'o //dang po la 9(?) ste /zhu rten bya ba'i phyir mchod yon sta gong du gna[s]...
Fragmentary at l. and r.: ll. 10 recto + 10 verso of gooddbu medscript.
From a work on normal, public Buddhist ritual: cf.1089 and pl. cxxxii.
recto, 1 -bzo[?] dang gsol gyi mchod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba byas la /OM pra tim b+hya zhes pas sa la lag pa reg pa tsam zhes te sa'i cha de nyid la...

K.K.v.b.017.k (IOL Tib M 705); 013.u (IOL Tib M 807); 008.e (IOL Tib M 806); E.G.014.ss (IOL Tib M 903), gg (IOL Tib M 916); 014.aa (IOL Tib M 904); ee (IOL Tib M 905), ww (IOL Tib M 805); 023.a.iii (IOL Tib M 906); 023.ll (IOL Tib M 799); 013.gg (IOL Tib M 914), kk (IOL Tib M 918); 023.a.iv (IOL Tib M 909); 014.dd (IOL Tib M 802); 014.ll (IOL Tib M 801); 014.kk (IOL Tib M 800), oo (IOL Tib M 804); 023.ss (IOL Tib M 907); 023.ww (IOL Tib M 915); rr (IOL Tib M 908); 014.jj (IOL Tib M 798); scraps ofdbu canscript, various sizes and styles, in K.K.v.b.008.e (IOL Tib M 806) and f (IOL Tib M 1012), 017.k (IOL Tib M 705), 013.d (IOL Tib M 699?), with notes in smalldbu med.
Miscellaneous.
In E.G.014.jj (IOL Tib M 798) mention (ll. 3 and 7) of the teacherKlu'i byang chub(Nāgabodhi) and of theBhadra-kalpa-sūtra; in E.G.014.gg (IOL Tib M 916) (ll. 6) of aZa hor Bande.
K.K.v.b.08.e (IOL Tib M 806) mentionsPāramitā.
One folded into foll. two 11.5 x 7cm., one blank: ll. 6 of normaldbu canscript.
Buddhist Tāntrik ritual.
recto, 1-2gsum brgya drug cu gshegsu gsol/dza' khrag 'thun chen po'i spyan snga ru/...
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of ordinary, rather large,dbu canscript; marginal numberrgyad, '8'.
Prayer to Gods and fiends in verses of seven syllables.

p.q:
@@//hahUM spar kha lo 'gros pho brang dang/
/lha srin sde brgyad khor dang bcas/

note.p: A complete fol.: ll. 4 recto + 4 verso of small, neat,dbu canscript: in recto, 3, the phraserdo rjeis in red.
Description of some Buddhist Tātrik divinity.
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript with passages in smalldbu medof a late type.
Ritual.
Practically complete: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of neat, backwards-slantingdbu canscript, subnormal size: marginal number '10'(?).
Consequences of death at certain times in certain years.
recto, 2 -/spyir lo pa'i tun rtsis gshed mda' ni/byi ba'i nyi ma la mi shi na/gshed lho nas 'ong/pho'i gzugsu 'dug pa ni/...
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript, a somewhat smaller size and possible a different hand: marginal numberdrug, '6'.
From a Buddhist sūtra. Dialogue betweenBuddhaandSubhūticoncerning the decay of the good religion after 500 years.
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of neatdbu canscript, normal size; marginal numberbrgyad, '8'.
Bdud rtsi snying po yan lag brgyad pa gsang ba man ngag gi rgyud(Amrta-hṛdaya-aṅgāṣṭa-guhya-upadeśa-tantra).
A medical text.
End of chapter 2. (verso, 2-3)lus kyi chags tshul bstan pa'i le'u'Chapter teaching the mode of connection with body' = vol. II, Chapter II, in the India Office Library MS., Lha-sa Expedition, D. 1.
Fragmentary: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript, mixed withdbu med, small size.
Ritual withmantras.
A fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of normaldbu medscript.
Arya Mi tri pra Ni[ dhA na](Ārya-Maitrī-praṇidhāha, cf.II (III), p. 525, Mdo, CXXXVI. 25)
Mentions (verso, 2, 7) theBhadracarī-praṇidhāna-rāja

A complete fol.: (1) ll. 4 of normaldbu canscript, number '2': (2) ll. 4 of similardbu canscript, followed by l. 1 ofdbu med, medium size; (3) l. 1 of similar normaldbu can+ l. 1 ofdbu med; (4) ll. 2 1/2 of similar normaldbu can+ ll. 2 1/2 ofdbu med.
Unintelligible phrases, with numerals, (personal names medicaments?).
Begins, [1]@@//shar hal 'a rtsar ka'i bu /tun khun/zar pa/'u no ka[2]ba ka tshe thar ha ra a tsar ka'i bu tun kun/...
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 4 + 1 recto of ordinarydbu canscript, sub-normal size.
From some prayer.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 1 recto + 5 verso of gooddbu canscript normal size; marginal numbergcig, '1'.
Title page and beginning of -Tshe dbang brgyud pa'i gsol 'debs(Āyur-vaśa-tantra-prārthana (abhyarthana)).
A complete fol.: ll. 4 recto + 4 verso of ordinarydbu canscript, large size.
Ritual for attainment of objects (mi rnams kyi 'dod don 'grub, recto, 3-4).
MentionsU(rl)ung rta, 'Wind horse'.
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 3 verso of normaldbu canscript: marginal number,gnyis, '2'.
Ritual, withmantras.
MentionsHeruka(a, ll. 4-5, ll. 1),Vajravārāhī(verso, 1), etc. andsA tstsha(recto, 2, verso, 2) and asA tstsha' cho ga(verso, 3).
(Sāccha-vidhi: cf.I (II), p. 85SA tstsha gdab pa'i cho ga, Rgyud, 21, fol. 525, p. 104, Rgyud, 23, fol. 338, p. 319, Rgyud, 68, foll. 214-5).
Fragmentary: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinary, rather clumsy,dbu canscript, mainly large size, some phrases red.
Ritual withmantras.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 2 verso of normaldbu canscript, with some phrases in a smaller hand; marginal numberbcu, '10'.
Ritual withmantras.
Fragmentary: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of normaldbu canscript.
Account of various herbs or medicaments, etc.
zhi byed dkar po drug pa(recto, 1),cong zhi sel spyod(recto, 3),ra rta drug pa(recto, 4),se 'bru rgya[l] blon gsum(recto, 7),rtsul la byud brgyad thar(verso, 4),spos dkar bcu pa(verso, 6), etc.
A complete foll.: ll. 3 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript, several sizes, interspersed (verso) withdbu med, small size.
Mnol bzang gtong par PaN chen rin po che la sogs kyi gsungs. Sayings of thePaN chen rin po che(Dalai Lama) and others to cure weakness or dulness?
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of good normaldbu canscript: marginal numberbzhi, '4'.
Religious ritual, relating apparently to horses and weapons.
Mentionsrta mchog gro zhur(recto, 5),mdung,mda'(recto, 7, verso, 7),gzhu(verso, 1)mtshon cha(verso, 4), etc.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of calligraphicdbu canscript, ordinary size, with passages in a smaller hand.
Ritual withmantras, perhaps for getting rid of obstacles (bgegs, recto, 3, 7, verso, 2, etc.).
Ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of good normaldbu canscript.
Namaskāras to variousTathāgatas.
Complete: ll. 6 recto of clumsydbu canscript, ordinary size, with some flourishes verso.
List ofBhikṣus with numbered objects, chiefly sheep.
L. 4 -dge [sl]ong khas grub chos 'phel lug//
Fragmentary at top left: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of normaldbu canscript: marginal numberbdun, '7'.
From a hymn?

recto, 4 -/lung bstan spyin [sbyin?] par bya ba'i sar gnas kyi/
/dpa' [bo] mgo la nyug par mdzad pa dang/
/gang du bris pa'i sa kun bkra shis pa/
/'di yi reg bya'i dpen nam mkha'i rtsa/...
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto of cleardbu medscript, medium size, with many compendia scribendi.
A list of images, etc. (??)
L. 2.....drug pa zur sman pa dpaldang ya du ra lug...
Somewhat fragmentary at r.: ll. 2 of neatdbu medscript, small size, well spaced, smeared over with red, with a blessing in a different hand below.
End of some text mentioningrnal 'byor dang 'brel byunganddmigs 'tsho mo, i. e.yogaandpratītya-samutpāda, andālambana-.
A right-hand fragment: ll. 8 recto + 7 verso of cleardbu medscript, small size, with interlineations in a minute hand.
From adhāraṇīorsādhana.
K.K.v.b.017.d (IOL Tib M 951), 012.a (IOL Tib M 970), b (IOL Tib M 734), 031.b (IOL Tib M 950), h (IOL Tib M 815), 010.a (IOL Tib M 817).
Described and figured in1087-1090 and Pll.CXXXI-III.
K.K.v.b.017.d (IOL Tib M 951) ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of very neat and artistic dbu med script, followed verso by a note in a minute hand; marginal number, 13. See1090 and Pl. CXXXIII.
K.K.v.b.012.a (IOL Tib M 970) ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of artisticdbu medscript; marginal number,ka, '1'. See1089 and Pl. CXXXIII.
K.K.v.b.012.b (IOL Tib M 734) fragmentary at l.: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of elegantdbu medscript. See1087 and Pl. CXXXI.
K.K.v.b.031.b (IOL Tib M 950) ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of minute, neat,dbu medscript; marginal number 39. See1090 and Pl. CXXXIII.

K.K.v.b.031.h (IOL Tib M 815) recto, two concentric circular bands, enclosing a flower-shaped figure of four petals with a circular centre: in the five compartments pieces of minutedbu medscript; outside the figure ll. 2 at left, and a short phrase at right, of similar script; verso, a similar figure; on an attached fol. ll. 9 x 8 of text. See1088 and Pl. CXXXII.
K.K.v.b.010.a (IOL Tib M 817) ll. 9 recto + 1 verso, of neatdbu medscript, rubbed in places. See1090 and Pl. CXXXIII.
A right-hand fragment: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of cleardbu medscript, smallish size, with some interlineations in a minute hand; citations smeared red.
From a text relating to thebhavāgra(srid pa'i rtse mo, recto, 1, verso, 8), theanāgāmin(phyir mi 'ong ba, recto, 4), thepāramitās (recto, 5, etc.), the 8vimokṣas (recto, 9, etc.).
Fragmentary at bottom and at r: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of very neatdbu medscript, partly abraded; marginal number,so drug, '36'; citations rubbed over in red.
Apparently from some work onYoga.
Passages commented on seem to be
recto, 5 -...nas dpal rdo rje sems pa'i gnas la..., recto 6 -de bzhin gshegs pa thaMd (thams cad) ni
verso, 7 -nyon mongs ...r ba'i nyon mongs pa [g]cod, verso, 8 -dam pa chos gyi grong khyer bskyang ba ni
Originally folded concertina-wise into 2 foll. ll. 8 + 6 + 6 + 7 of fairly neat dbu med(?) script; drawing of a face verso.
Perhaps an amulet.
Begins:@//ki kang nyi ma 'khros pa yi sro[g] nyang drangs ste...
'Ki kang having brought mischievous (gnyan) heat of the angered sun...'
OnKi kang, a demon, see the Lexx.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of cleardbu medscript, with two passages smeared red, and one or two interlineations in a minute hand; marginal number,zhe bzhi, '44'.

Concerning the soul's estate in various births (kṣetras), a commentary? The phrases -shi 'pho ba(recto, 4) andgsugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba(verso, 3), seem to be citations. gsugs kyi'dod chags=rūpa-kāma
recto, 1 occurs the phrasemthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa(=dṛṣṭa-dharme suṣṭhita?).
A right-hand fragment: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of very neat and elegantdbu medscript, small size.
Relates perhapas to the career of aBodhisattva, exhibiting compassion to beings in various stages of existence.
recto, 1 -dud 'gro la nags khung rnaMs na ma shi bar sha za khrag 'thung byed pa'i du kha de rnaMs ma bzod na[s]/de rnaMs kyi don du rang sdu[g] bsngal ba la...
du kha=duḥ-kha
'the animals which, if they do not die in their forest holes, have the pain of their blood being drunk by carnivora'.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neatdbu medscript of a late type, small size; marginal numberdgu, '9'.
recto, 1/nga dud gro dang/yi dwags nyid dang myal bar skye ba dang/rgyal ba'i bka' med pa dang mtha' 'khob tu /kla klor skyes dang glen gling lkugs pa nyid/

'[May] I [escape from] birth as a beast or a wild animal or an infernal being or one without Buddhas Word or a foreign dwarf (mtha' 'khob), a Muslim (kla klo), from mute stupidity (glen gling lkugs pa nyid), etc., etc.'
Refers apparently to states of rebirth, and mentions Tibet as a religious country, -
Bod 'di chos tshig gi dbang du byas pa'i yul dbus(verso, 2).
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of neatdbu medscript, medium size; marginal numbernyer gsum, '23'.
From a ritual text concerning a vow.

recto, 1-2 -sngon gyi dam tshig[ g]nyen po nye bar dgongs/
/bsal yas mchim phu gsung gi dben gnas su/
/slob dpon chen po padma thor 'phreng gis/
/bde gshegs 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor zhal phye nas//
The text seems therefore to have been composed by a teacherPadma thor 'phrengofMchims phu, nearBsam yas, and to relate to theKāla-cakra.

In ll. 5-6 there seems to be mention of aBlo bzang snyan 'gyur Ring lugs Grags pa'i dbyangs, who is described as -dus gsum rgyal ba'i spyi gzugs mchog'the best of the mass of vanquishers of the three times'.
A practically complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of gooddbu medscript, largish size, with some interlineations in a small hand; citations of rubrics smeared with colour.
From a text withbījākṣaras.

recto, 1dus gsum 'gon [po]s de skad bshad///
//snang srid srid pa'i 'ong[s] spyod rnam[s] lnga'o...
'Thus said the lord of Three Times: 'The enjoyments of the state of the visible world (snang srid) are five''.
recto, 3rgyu las byung ba'i bdud [rtsi] chen po 'di
'this great ambrosia produced from a cause'.
With several gaps: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neatdbu medscript, with interlineations in a minute hand.
Apparently ritual of theVajrācāryakind.
Begins -/de nang yab yum dam bsrel//bdud rtsi blangs la badzra bo de tsi ta huM ho /ces pa...
Theyab yumandvajra-bodhi-cittapoint to theVajrācāryaBuddhism.
Mentionsblang dor myed par.
Nearly complete, but with holes: ll. 12 recto + 13 verso of gooddbu medscript, smallish size, considerably abraded; ruled in colour; marginal number,drug, '6'.
Apparently worship of divinities, includingNāgas (recto, 10), and fierce powers (11).
A left-hand fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neatdbu medscript, medium size, with a few interlineations in a minute hand; much abraded recto and somewhat verso.
Mention of certain objects, probably letters of the alphabet, in a numbered order.

verso, 4bzhi pa'i dang po gang ying dang/
/mthar gnas pa'i gzhi pa dang...
'the first of the fourth [series, i.e. labials, viz. p] and the fourth (sc. v) of theantasthas [i.e.antahsthas, 'semivowels']...'
Coll. of numeral figures with a rubric indbu canscript, medium size.
The rubric reads -Grub rtsis rtag longs(astronomy? arithmetic? accounts?).
Collection of numerical figures, with words or phrases,dbu cananddbu med, as headings, etc.
No doubt calendrical. The headings, etc., are numerical, or give names of years, etc.
Coll. of figures.
No doubt calendrical.
Coll. of figures
Probably calendrical.
Coll. of numerical figures, with some headings indbu canordbu medsript.
Calendrical, with names of years, etc.

E.G.016.a.iii (IOL Tib M 989); 016.vv (IOL Tib M 752); 016.nn (IOL Tib M 853); 017.r (IOL Tib M 852); 017.s (IOL Tib M 851); 016.xx (IOL Tib M 988); 016.ww (IOL Tib M 850); 016.tt (IOL Tib M 995); 016.mm (IOL Tib M 994); 016.ss (IOL Tib M 993); 016.pp (IOL Tib M 996); 016.a.v (IOL Tib M 992); 016.a.xxvi (IOL Tib M 884); 016.a.xxi (IOL Tib M 991); 016.a.xix (IOL Tib M 990); 016.qq (IOL Tib M 997)

From aPrajñā-pāramitā.

E.G.016.cc (IOL Tib M 755); 023.a.xii (IOL Tib M 754); 016.ee (IOL Tib M 764); 016.dd (IOL Tib M 753); 016.a.xviii (IOL Tib M 987) three left-hand + one right-hand + one middle fragment of one or more copies of the same volume: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; marginal numbers left-hand, recto and verso, in Tibetan, right-hand in Chinese.
From aChos spyod(Dharma-caryā).
(1) 016.cc (IOL Tib M 755), marginal number etc.Chos spyod re dgu gongand'og, 'Chos spyod69, a and b').
(2) 023.a.xii (IOL Tib M 754), marginal numbergya gsum gongand'og, ' 83, a and b').
(3) 016.ee (IOL Tib M 764), marginal numberbrgya gong.., 'lxx, a'
(4) 016.dd (IOL Tib M 753), marginal number (Chinese) '69 a and b'.
(5) 016.a.xviii (IOL Tib M 987)

No (2), 023.a.xii (IOL Tib M 754), has (verso, 1-2) part of a colophon, mentioning theLama Dpal 'byor lhun grub, the XIthLcang skya rol pa'i rdo rje(Peking Huthuktu), eho(?) composed the work in(?) theDgang(sic) ldanpalace.
Concerning the quasi titleChos spyodsee under 016.e (IOL Tib M 12).
A left-hand bottom fragment: ll. 5 recto of ordinarydbu canxylograph, the latter part, a colophon being of smaller size; border lines; marginal title and number[B]gegs bzhi byon sel, 'Bgegs sel4'.
'Bgegs sel mdo rgyu sbyor tsha ba'
'Obstacle removing, sūtra material supply heat (?).'
Perhaps different from theVighna-vināyaka-nāma-dhāraṇīrecorded byp. 130, Bka' 'gyur, Rgyud, 18, fol. 182.
A left-hand portion: ll. 1 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; marginal title and numberTa nor gcig, 'Vol (?) IXNor1'.
A rya ku be ra ratna b+ha b+ha sa rba ta,'Phags pa nor phyugs bsrung...zhing spel ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs(Ārya-Kuvera-ratna...dhāraṇī)
'Dhāraṇī named 'Wealth and cattle protector farm prosperer'.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, smallish size; border lines; marginal title and number almost entirely lost.
Mentions'brug sgra(recto, 5),Dīpaṃkara, (verso, 1),Atiśa(verso, 4).
Apparently from a work bychos smra ba(dharma-bhāṇaka)Btsun pa dge 'dun rgya mtsho(verso, 5), the IInd Dalai Lama (1479-1541 A.D.).
A right-hand fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph, smudged.
End of adhāraṇīwork and beginning of -Arya A pa ri mi ta A yur dznya na 'ri da ya naA ma dhA ra NI(Ārya-Aparimita-Āyur-jñāna-hṛdaya-nāma-dhāraṇī).
For the work seep. 122, Rgyud, 15, foll. 349-352.
A practically complete fol: ll. 2 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, smallish size; marginal numbergcig, '1'.

p.q: Khyab bdag rdo rje 'chang chen po Ta 'i kau shrI btsan po Smin grol no mon han gyi sprul ba'i sku rin po che gang 'di nyid kyi sku skyes pa'i rab las gtso bor brtsams te gsol 'debs shing brtan

note.p: A prayer relating to the greatRdo rje 'chang(Vajradhara)Ta 'i kau Srii btsan po, theNo mon hanof theSmin grolmonastry, (perhaps not that in Tibet (277), but a namesake in Mongolia) (cf. 022.z (IOL Tib M 169)) and his reincarnations.
Begins -OM swa sti/gdong nas rnam par dag pa chos sku'i mkhar/lhan grub mtshan dpe'i gzi byin 'bar ba'i nyi

E.G.016.aa (IOL Tib M 855); 017.p (IOL Tib M 854); 017.o (IOL Tib M 761); 016.a.xxiii (IOL Tib M 882); 016.a.xxii (IOL Tib M 881); 016.a.xx (IOL Tib M 880); 017.d (IOL Tib M 762), n (IOL Tib M 763); paper, fragments of one or more copies of one volume, or one or more volumes: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines; marginal titles and numbers, recto and verso, in left-hand fragments, Tibetan and Chinese.
(1) 016.aa (IOL Tib M 855), marginal title and numberDang gsum re re sder mo gong(vol.(?) XI, 53Re re sder moa, and b' (Chinese '53a and b')).
Re re sder mo(?)

(2) 017.p (IOL Tib M 854), marginal title and number versoCha so brgyad Zams pa'i mtshan 'og(Vol.(?) 'V, 38,Zams pa'i mtshan, b', recto,Cha so brgyad Yum mtshan gong'vol.(?) V, 38,Yum mtshan, a' (Chinese '38 a and b')).
Zams mtshanandYum mtshan('Succession names' and 'Mother names'?).
(3) 017.o (IOL Tib M 761)
(4) 016.a.xxiii (IOL Tib M 882)
(5) 016.a.xxii (IOL Tib M 881)
(6) 016.a.xx (IOL Tib M 880)
(7) 017.d (IOL Tib M 762)
(8) 017.n (IOL Tib M 763)
From somePrajñā-pāramitā, or text or texts relating thereto.
A right-hand fragment: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines.
From a Buddhist sūtra. MentionsĀnanda(recto, 5),Śāradvatī-putra(verso, 2),daśa-bala(verso, 3), etc...

E.G.015.aa (IOL Tib M 766), bb (IOL Tib M 870), cc (IOL Tib M 871), dd (IOL Tib M 872), ee (IOL Tib M 873), hh (IOL Tib M 876), jj (IOL Tib M 877), kk (IOL Tib M 878); 016.uu (IOL Tib M 767); 016.a.viii (IOL Tib M 879); 019.a.ii (IOL Tib M 889), fragments of one or more copies of one or more works: ll. 10 recto + 10 verso of ordinary xylograph, large size; border lines; one fragment has a marginal number in Tibetan and Chinese.

(2) E.G.015.bb (IOL Tib M 870)

(9)E.G.016.uu (IOL Tib M 767)

E.G.016.a.i (IOL Tib M 770) and 014.nn (IOL Tib M 768), 023.a.xi (IOL Tib M 769); transparent; one complete fol.; the second somewhat fragmentary: ll. 4 recto of normaldbu canxylograph; marginal title and numberRtsa rgyud gnyis brgya re bzhi gong,Tsa rgyud'264a' andnyis brgya dun 'og, '2-7b'.
Rtsa rgyud(Mūla-tantra)

Recto: [1]@@//rdo rje'i bdag nyid gsum 'das nas/
/rdo rje'i yi ge 'jig par 'gyur/
/lha mo klu mo gnod sbyin ma/...
Worship ofNāgīs,Yakśīs etc.
Also 023.a.xi (IOL Tib M 769), marginal numberTsa rgyud, '15a',Rtsa rgyud bco lnga gong.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph largish size.
Probably a philosophic commentary. Mentionssaṃvṛti(kun rdzob, recto, 6, 7, verso, 1, 4),jñāna jñeya, (verso, 2),Buddhacakṣus(verso, 7), etc.
Ll. 4 recto of ordinarydbu canxylograph, largish size, reversed in printing or transparent, faint.
Illegible.
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; marginal numbertsha lnga, 'vol.(?) XVIII, 5'.
End (verso, 5) of a prayer toDmag zor rgyal mo(?), and beginning of aRgyal chen rnam thos sras kyi gtor 'bul(Mahārāja-Vaiśravaṇa-bali).

E.G.014.vv (IOL Tib M 774), xx (IOL Tib M 869), left-hand and right-hand fragments originally folded in concertina form, with foll.- x 6cm: ll. 5 per page of normaldbu canxylograph, red; in 014.xx (IOL Tib M 869) at most very faint; border lines.
Invocations.
E.G.016.a.xiii (IOL Tib M 776), xiv (IOL Tib M 775), ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; marginal number, in xiii, '3'.
The two foll. are consecutive; but as they were originally folded in concertina form, the text verso may be different from that exemplified recto.
Recto:Me long ye shes kyi tshigs bcad rkang pa dang bcas bcu(Darpaṇa-jñāna-kārikā,pāda-sahita daśa?)
Mentions thegaṇḍī(xiii, recto, 3).

xiv, recto, 1, - praise ofMañjughoṣa-/'jam dbyangs chen po sgra che pa/
/'jig rten gsum na sgra gcig pa/
/nam mkha'i mtha' klas sgra sgros pa/
/sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mcho ba (mchog)/
verso: mentions various diseases and divinities: alsoSiṭātapatra,vajra-uṣṇīṣa-mahā-pratyaṅgirā(xiii, verso, 6).
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript, red ink; marginal number (black)sum cu thams la, '32'.
Invocations toBuddha.

recto, 1 -//khyab bdag chen po rin chen gtugs (gdugs)/
/sangs rgyas kun gyi gzi brjid cha/...
E.G.016.a.xvii (IOL Tib M 778); 017.v (IOL Tib M 780), foll. 2 nearly complete: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph: marginal numbersso bzhi, '34' andzhe bzhi'44'.
(1) Ritual withmantras. Mentions 'water demons', (chu srin, recto, 1).
(2) Perhaps from anUṣṇīṣa-vijayā-sita-ātapatra(dhāraṇī, or the like).
(gdugs dkar, recto, 6, verso, 6;gtsug torverso, 3, 6).
A practically complete fol.; originally part of a book in 'concertina' form: ll. 5 recto of normaldbu canxylograph.
Ritual.
Mentions agser skyems, 'gold drink' (see Lexx.) (verso, 2),Yakṣas, etc., (ll. 4-5).
Ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph.
Ritual withmantras.
MentionsŚārīputra(2, l. 2) and perhapsĀnanda(2, l. 6).
Originally folded in foll. 5, c. 13.5 x 5.5 cm: ll. 20 of normaldbu canxylograph, followed by ll. 5 of smaller size.

p.title: 'Phags pa De bzhin gshegs pa gtsug tor nas byung ba'i gdugs dkar po can gzhan gyis mi thub phyir zlog pa chen mo mchog tu grub pa

note.p: (Ārya-Tathāgata-uṣṇīṣa-udbhava-sita-ātapa-travad-aparājita-mahā-pratyangirā-parama-siddhi).
This is apparently the work recorded byp. 106, Bka' 'gyur, Rgyud, 14, fol. 336.
E.G.016.a.xii (IOL Tib M 859); 016.ff (IOL Tib M 789); 017.b (IOL Tib M 787), g (IOL Tib M 783), k (IOL Tib M 784), m (IOL Tib M 857); 023.a.xv (IOL Tib M 788) and xvi (IOL Tib M 1000)
Five fragments of probably several volumes: ll. 5 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines.
(1) 016.a.xii (IOL Tib M 859), mentions the '75 lords' (recto, 4), 'black horse' (recto, 2), 'enemy' (verso, 3). No doubt Tāntrik ritual
(2) 016.ff (IOL Tib M 789), marginal title and numberChos spyod brgya bcu(?) bzhi, 'Chos spyod114'.
From a 'Chos spyod' (Dharma-caryā).
Mentions thedaśa-śīla(recto, 5),Bka' 'dams(recto, 6), and prayer to'Bebs(?) mkhas Bskal bzang rgya mtsho.
On the quasi titleChos spyodsee under 016.e (IOL Tib M 12).
(3) 017.b (IOL Tib M 787). Ritual. Recto, 5 has a colophon mentioning a blessing (maṅgala) composed byBha va chen Khyung po?
(4) 017.g (IOL Tib M 783), fragment, much smudged. Prayers etc. Mentions (verso, 5)Mkhas grub Chos kyi rgyal po Nor bzang rgya mtsho
(5) 017.k (IOL Tib M 784), a left-hand fragment; marginal title and numberRnam sras lnga, 'Rnam sras5'.
Ritual, perhaps connected withVaiśravaṇa. Mentionsamṛta(recto, 2),mudrā(recto, 4),siddhi(recto, 5),vajra-dhara(recto, 6),nātha(mgon po) (recto, 5, verso, 2, 4),ne'u le(verso, 5).
(6) 017.m (IOL Tib M 857), a left-hand fragment; marginal title and number[Chos] spyod brgya nyer gsum, 'Chos spyod, 123'
AChos spyod(Dharma-caryā)
(7) 023.a.xv (IOL Tib M 788), mentions 'black Kubera' (recto, 2),Yakṣa(recto, 4),nātha(mgon po) (verso, 2),Vaiśravaṇa(verso, 4).

(2) 017.c (IOL Tib M 791), ritual withmantras. Mentionsmahā-pratyaṅgirā(recto, 2), the twenty-eight constellations (recto, 4),aparājita-mālā(recto, 7),Tārā(verso, 1),Vajra-kumāra-vidyādhara(verso, 1) etc.

From a 'Gcin 'gegs gso ba'i le'u', 'Urine-retention-cure chapter'
of a -[Zug rngu'i tsha gdung se]l ba'i ka ngpa dus min 'ch[i'i zhag]s gcod pa'i ral gri(śalyoṣṇatāpanāntakṛt kātpūral?)- A-kāla-mṛtyu-pāśa-ccheda-khaḍga,
concerning which work see under E.G.013.d (IOL Tib M 3) and 016.c (IOL Tib M 254); cf. 016.r (IOL Tib M 165) and 024.q (IOL Tib M 16).
E.G.014.bb (IOL Tib M 858); 017.t (IOL Tib M 790), w (IOL Tib M 856); three fragments: ll. 7 recto + 2 verso, 6 recto + 2 verso, 5 of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines.
Ends of works of an invocatory ordhāraṇīkind.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, large size; border lines.

Formulae and invocations.
A complete foll.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of ordinarydbu canscript; marginal number, recto and verso,gnyis, '2'.
Invocations toGlud kyi rgyal po(Glud = 'Scapegoat'),Klu kyi rgyal po(Klu =nāga) etc., against disease.

Directions forYoga?

recto, 1-2//sha khrag longs spyod mthun pa'i dam rdzas tshogs/...

(IOL Tib M 1042) + 3 unnumbered; 013.n (IOL Tib M 1043) many fragments; 017.l (IOL Tib M 1044), m (IOL Tib M 1045), n (IOL Tib M 1046), o (IOL Tib M 1047); 031.b (IOL Tib M 950), j (IOL Tib M 1048), l (IOL Tib M 1050), m (IOL Tib M 1051), n (IOL Tib M 1052): P, many fragments; iii.029.l (IOL Tib M 810), m (IOL Tib M 811), n (IOL Tib M 812); x.
Numerous scraps, various shapes and sizes: ll. for the most part of neat or elegantdbu medscript, of various sizes, in some cases with interlineations in small or minute hands.

From abali(gtor ma, verso, 3) ritual?
09.o (IOL Tib M 1033), irregular fragments: ll. 5 (parts) of gooddbu canscript, normal size, with some interlineations indbu med, small size.
recto, 5 mentions a -...dgos pa nye bar bstand pa'i shugs kyi tshig le'ur byas pa, akārikā.
Nearly complete: ll. 8 recto of very neat, small,dbu medscript, with a lotus diagram, containing charm syllables, verso.
An amulet(?), mentioning the different senses.

A fragment from the left-hand part of a fol.: ll. 10 recto + 10 verso of neat dbu med script, rather minute size; marginal number,ka, 'Vol(?) I, 3'.

Buddhist Tantrik ritual: mentions -dgra brlag par byed(recto, 2, 'defeat of enemy'),'dod pa'i dbang phyug(recto, 5,Kāmeśvara, 'lord of desire'),hi hir bzhad cing(recto, 6, 'laughing displeasedly'),khrag chen he ru ka(recto, 9, 'the bloody Heruka'),grub chen(verso, 8,mahā-siddha), etc.
A complete fol.: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of elegantdbu medscript, small size, with one interlinear note in a still smaller hand; marginal number '3'.
Dialogue betweenBuddhaandĀnandaconcerning friends and conduct.
recto, 1-3 -/lta ba mthun pa gal che/spyod pa ma mthun na dang po sna snyer dang zhe snyer mang/gnyis pa na gzhan gyi rtsar phyin tsam na .../3 par btsag dang 'grogs na dmar...

A right-hand fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neatdbu medscript, small size, with interlineations in a smaller hand.
Ritual withmantras.
A fragment: ll. 7 recto + 4 verso of cleardbu medscript, smallish size; interlineations in a minute hand.
From adhāraṇīorsādhana. Mentions aḍākinī(recto, 2), the 6Pāramitās (3), etc.

A left-hand fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of neatdbu medscript, smallish size; marginal number,bzhi(?) bcu, '40'.
Ritual. MentionsBuddhaandMāmakī(recto, 7).
A practically complete fol.: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of neatdbu medscript small size, with one or two interlineations; marginal number,bcu, '10'.
From adhāraṇīorsādhana.

'on the circle of the moon in themātṛkālotus an A emitting A rays...'
A fragment: ll. 9 recto + 9 verso of neatdbu medscript, small size.
Ritual?
A fragment: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of very neatdbu medscript, with parts of ll. 2 written or impressed crosswise.
Namaskāras toBuddhas.
A fragment: ll. 8 of elegantdbu medscript, small size.
From adhāraṇī(gzungs).
A fragment: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of cleardbu medscript, large size, with some interlineations in a minute hand.

The expressionmos pa(adhimokṣa) recurs verso, 5.

Originally folded in concertina form, ll. 4 (p. 1) + l3 (p. 2) + 4 1/2 (p. 3) of ordinarydbu medscript, medium size, rather faint, followed by 11. c. 15 in a different rather smaller, distinct, hand; ll. 1-4 (p. 1) seem to be in a different hand from the rest, unless it is identical with the second hand already mentioned.
Apparently medical, followed by amantrafor avertion diseases.
A practically complete fol., book form: ll. 19 recto + 19 verso of cleardbu medscript, small size, with some interlineations in a different hand.
From a hymn to Buddha
Ends (verso, 19) -lung bstan thob cing 'gro ba'i ... chos rje spya nga rin chen dang zhabs la 'tshal 'dud//
dangadded below line,'tshaladded below line

E.G.010.i (IOL Tib M 835), j, k, l (IOL Tib M 835) 4 pieces, various sizes: ll. recto and verso of excellent, elegant,dbu medscript, smallish size, more than one hand.
Fragments from Buddhist texts.

E.G.019.a.i (IOL Tib M 888), v (IOL Tib M 839), vi (IOL Tib M 838); 023.a.xxvi (IOL Tib M 863), xxv; 019.a.viii-xvi (IOL Tib M 890-897); 015.yy (IOL Tib M 836), xx (IOL Tib M 837), gg (IOL Tib M 875), ff (IOL Tib M 874); 014.pp (IOL Tib M 983); 017.y (IOL Tib M 886); various fragments of xylographs.

MentionsGautamaśūra(recto, 5, 7),srin mo(recto, 8),yakṣa(recto, 4, b, 1).

Mentionskula-devī(recto, 2, 8, verso, 3), 'king' (recto, 3, verso, 1, 2),sūtra(verso, 2),Tathāgata(verso, 7).
A left-hand fragmet: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines; marginal numberKa dgu gongand'og(Vol.(?) I, '9a and b' also Chinese '9a and b').
No doubt ritual. Mentionsmahā-Brahman(recto, 3),yakṣa(recto, 4), etc.

msItem.note:
E.G.016.a.ii (IOL Tib M 848), iv (IOL Tib M 847), vii (IOL Tib M 846), x (IOL Tib M 845); 016.oo (IOL Tib M 844), zz (IOL Tib M 843), six fragments of one or more copies of one or more works: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso normaldbu canxylograph; border lines; marginal title and numbers, recto Tibetan and Chinese, in the two left-hand fragments.
(1) 016.a.ii (IOL Tib M 848), a left-hand fragment: marginal title and number 'Mgon po kla12'; also Chinese 'II. 12a'.
Mentions 'animals' (recto, 6), 'flesh and blood' (recto, 8), 'Yak flesh' (verso, 6), 'sheep' (recto, 7), etc.
(2) 016.iv (IOL Tib M 847), mentionsyakṣas (recto, 2), 'blood and flesh' (recto, 3 and verso 8),bali(recto, 8),ḍamaru(verso, 7), etc.
(3) 016.a.vii (IOL Tib M 846), mentionscakra(recto, 2),dril bu(recto, 6),bla ma(recto, 1, verso, 3, etc.), mutteredmantra(verso, 8), etc.
(4) 016.a.x (IOL Tib M 845), mentionsŚrī-Devī(recto, 2),yogin(recto, 4),mahākāla(recto, 8),samādhi(verso, 4), 'black dog' (verso, 1), etc.
(5) 016.oo (IOL Tib M 844), a fragment: marginal title and number 'Mgon po,kha14', Chinese 'II. 14a and b'.Mentions 'all demons' (recto, 6), 'enemies and obstacles' (verso, 4), etc.
(6) 016.zz (IOL Tib M 843), a right-hand fragment. Mentionsyakṣa(recto, 8),ne'u le(verso, 3), 'crest jewel' (verso, 3), etc.
The text or texts, seems to relate to Buddhist Tāntrik ritual.

note.p: A left-hand fragment: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of normal, rather large,dbu canxylograph; border lines; marginal title and numberBkra shis sum brgya na gsum gongand'og'Bkra shis, 353a and b', Chinese 353a.
From a Buddhist sūtra (Bkra shis...,Maṅgala...)?
Mentions 'city' (recto, 6 and 7),Shirisha(recto, 5) =śirīṣa?, etc.
E.G.016.a.xxiv (IOL Tib M 860), 017.q (IOL Tib M 861) two fragments: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of normaldbu canxylograph; border lines.

Concerning diseases of men and beasts, etc., in relation to particular years of the cycle.
9.@yang lcags pho nad phrad bu la ngan/nor la god kha 'phrid sman yin/

A list ofdge slongs with particulars of things (books?) deposited with (la) or delivered by (bzhag?) them.

Buddhist ritual.
1: recto, 5...gdan la oM las dug dkar po'i...

E.G.013.rr(?), 016.kk (IOL Tib M 885), a left-hand fragment and c. 23.5 x 14.5 cm, two nearly complete foll., ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of ordinarydbu canxylograph, smallish size; marginal numbersbzhi,bcu [drug?], andbcu bdun, '4', '16', '17'.
From a ritual text or texts, withmantras.
