'Phags phyir zlog rnam par rgyal ba can(Ārya-Pratyaṅgirā-vijayavant)
(Perhaps theĀrya-Vijayavatī-nāma-pratyaṅgirāofp. 115, Rgyud, 15, fol. 86, adhāraṇī?)
E.G.023.a.x (IOL Tib M 902), xiii (IOL Tib M 900), originally folded in two double foll.: ll. 1 + 5 + 5 + 5 of normaldbu canxylograph: marginal numbersgcig, '1' andgsum, '3'.

p.title: Gtsug tor rnam par rgyal ba'i gzungs

note.p: Uṣṇīṣa-vijayā-dhāraṇī, perhaps connected withdhāraṇī-bali,II (III), p. 259, Rgyud, 86, fol. 169.
Originally folded in foll. 3. c. 12 x 5.5 cm.: ll. 4 + 4 + 3 of normaldbu canscript.
Buddhist ritual withmantras.
A complete fol.: ll. 6 of normaldbu canscript.
Beginning of-'Phags pa tshe dang ye shes dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo(Ārya-Aparimitāyur-jñāna-nāma-ma-hā-yāna-sūtra, the well known text).
A complete fol.: ll. 2 recto + 5 verso of normaldbu canscript.
Title-page and beginning of-Chos spyod rnam(s) gsum gyi gsol kha
(Prayer opening for the three ways ofchos spyod(Dharma-caryā)).
Begins with a description ofVajra-bhairava.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 4 recto + 4 verso of normaldbu canscript; marginal numbergnyis, '2'.
Salutation and prayer toVajrapāṇi, etc.
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of normaldbu canscript, two phrases in red; marginal numberso gcig, '31'.
A hymn to some Buddhist divinity.
Mentions (recto, 5)Bu ston Rin chen grub, the historian of Buddhism and editor of the Tibetan Canon.
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of fairdbu canscript, small size; marginal number, '9' ('4'?), also (verso) 'OM'.
Buddhist hymn withmantras.

recto, 1-@@//gza' skar mang po'i tshogs kyis bskor/
/sa la bkra shis 'byung ba la/
/me chu sa rlung tshog kyis bskor//bar na bkra shis dkon mchog gsum/
'Girt with throngs of many planets and stars, on the earth a source of auspiciousness: girt with throngs of fire, water, earth, wind, in the middle space auspicious, the Three Gems...'
Ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of ordinarydbu canscript: see1088 and Pl. CXXXII.
Concerning a water-charm: see description in1088.
A fragment: ll. 6 recto + 1 verso of ordinarydbu canscript, followed by ll. 4 recto in a more cursive hand + l. 1 verso ofdbu med.
Dialogue betweenBuddhaandSubhūti, followed by casual writings.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 6 of ordinarydbu canscript, sub-normal size; marginal numbergsum, '3'.
Request ofSubhūtiand reply (byBuddha?).
A complete fol.: ll. 4 recto + 4 verso of neatdbu canscript, smallish size; marginal number,gzhi, '4'.
Perhaps from a prayer (in verse) toMañjughoṣa.

recto, 1-3gros stsol cig 'jam pa'i dbyangs/
/tshe rabs kun tu gzhan don kho na'i phyir/
/srid sna med par dngos po kun gtod zhing/
/rnam g.yeng med pa'i bsam gtan bsnom pa sogs/
A complete foll.: ll. 4 recto + 3 verso of normaldbu canscript
A prayer against thieves, etc., withmantras.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 5 verso mainly of neatdbu canscript, medium size, but with parts of some ll. indbu medof a late type, rather small size.
From a -Ya mAnta ka sA dha na(Yamāntaka-sādhana)
In the Bstan 'gyur are several so-namedsādhanas.
Nearly complete, but torn: ll. 1 recto + 3 verso of normaldbu canscript; marginal signga, '3'.
Title and beginning of a -Bsngo (?) ba smon lam'Blessing (orPariṇāmanā) prayer'.
A left-hand fragment: ll. 3 recto + 5 verso of normaldbu canscript; marginal numbergsum, '3'.
From a prayer for merit and kindness to living creatures.
Complete ll. 5 recto + 2 verso of normaldbu canscript.
Buddhistmantras (namaskāras).
A practically complete fol.: ll. 7 recto + 4 verso of ordinarydbu canscript + ll. 4 in a different, somewhat smaller hand.
Account of sums disbursed to certain persons and of medicines.
recto, 1 -paN chen na bza' pas mdzad pa sman nag chen po la/gtso bo phag ril thal ba zho drug/ma nu zho gsum/...
'Made by paṇḍit 'clothier' (na bza' pa), great black medicine-gtso bo phag ril(?) ash (or 'powder'), sixzho,ma nu(a mineral drug), threezho:...'
A complete fol.: ll. 2 recto (partly small size) + 5 verso of normaldbu canscript, the recto being in an inferior hand; marginal numbergcig'1'.
Title page and beginning ofbcom ldan 'das dpal rta mgrin gyi rnal 'byor brten nas lus sbyin byed tshul ku su la'i tshogs bsags byin brlabs myur 'jug
A ceremony in honour ofBhagavadHaya-grīva, 'Manner of making gift of body in reliance uponYogaofBhagavadŚrī-Hayagrīva, blessing of the equipment ofKusūla(exorcism), quickly entered into'.
A complete fol.: ll. 1 recto + 5 verso of ordinarydbu canscript, with an addedmantrarecto indbu med; marginal number, '1'.
Title page and beginning ofGod kha gcod pa'i mdosa charm against loss.
Begins -/rta nor lug gsum gyi god kha gcod pa'i thabs la/sems can gang yin gyi mgo rus thod pa bri/...
'means of precluding loss of horse, cattle, sheep, these three...'
Complete: ll. 7 of very neatdbu canscript, sub-normal size.
Ritual, invocation of aYi dam.

p.q: /rgyal po chen po ngal bsos po'i thugs kar rdo rje dmar po rtsi lnga ba'i lte bar...

note.p: 'the Great KingśramaṇaThugs dkar rdo rje dmar po('Red White heart vajra'?)...'

E.G.023.aa (IOL Tib M 932), bb (IOL Tib M 931), cc (IOL Tib M 933) three complete foll.: ll. 7 recto + 7 verso of gooddbu canscript, sub-normal size; marginal numbersbcu bzhi'14',bcu gnyis, '12',bco brgyad, '18'.
Concerning the text see1088, where 023.aa (IOL Tib M 932) is reproduced (Pl. CXXXII) and described.

'From the great Palace Potala the excellent lamas of theMūla-tantra...'
A complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of ordinarydbu canscript, smallish size; marginal numberbdrug, '6'.
From a description of a divinity(?)..

msItem.note:
A complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript: marginal numberlnga, '5'.
Weapon charms?
recto, 1 -@@//'phen bgegs la 'phen//da ni zor kha dgra la bsgyur//da ni zor kha bgegs la bsgyur//de nas la nuM (lan gsum?) brjod/hUM rnal 'byor dbang phyug mi zor no/...
rnal 'byor dbang phyug=yogeśvarazor,

note.p: A nearly complete fol.: ll. 1 recto + 5 verso of normaldbu canscript, someakṣaras in red; marginal numbergcig, '1'.
Sgrol ma maNDal bzhi pa'i cho ga bya tshul(Tārā-catur-maṇḍala-vidhi-kriyā).

A practically complete fol.: ll. 5 recto + 5 verso of neatdbu canscript small size; marginal number (red),gsum ba(bkum bar?) 1/2.
Concerning liberation from various ills: a story ofŚatakratu(Brgya byin) being troubled by four devils (bdud bzhi) and this being known to theBhagavat.
A nearly complete fol.: ll. 6 recto + 6 verso of normaldbu canscript; marginal numbergnyis, '2'.

recto, 3-de yang ci ltar gdab na/
/'phra na nad myed chad na rlag/
/bkra myi shes na rnos (dngos) grub med/
/g.yas su bskor na slob ma rlag/
/des na mnyam bzhag thig gdab bya/

'That also, how is it to be deposited? If with a struggle ('phra na) ...; if inauspiciously, there is no attainment; if with a rightward turn, the pupil is ruined; therefore the bindu (thig) is to be deposited with composure (mnyam bzag)'.

A medical work in verse.

recto, 1 -/khyi lce [d]kar po bsdungs la gtang/
/lce chung ba tha rkang (read hang?) theb kyi/
/spu nag [steng du ]...btsal bsdig/
/des kyang 'phan b[de] ma gyur na.../

The use of a 'dog's tongue, white', or 'great toe' (or 'thumb',theb), a 'black hair' (spu nag), and also the suggestion of a further remedy in case of failure ('phan bde ma gyur na), recur in such literature.
A right-hand fragment: ll. 8 recto + 8 verso of neatdbu medscript, small size, with citations or rubrics smeared red.
